snippet: Mr. Hastert, a former House speaker, is charged with structuring $1.7 million in withdrawals to avoid detection by banking officials and then lying about it to federal authorities.
abstract: Federal prosecutor says former Republican House Speaker J Dennis Hastert will plead guilty to charges of circumventing banking laws and lying about his actions to federal investigators; Hastert is accused of withdrawing $1.7 million in way meant to avoid detection; money was used to cover up accusations of sexual misconduct made against Hastert, although he has not been charged with any sex crimes.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hastert, a former House speaker, is charged with structuring $1.7 million in withdrawals to avoid detection by banking officials and then lying about it to federal authorities.

headline.print_headline: Hastert, Charged With Dodging Bank Laws and Lying About It, Reaches Plea Deal
headline.main: Dennis Hastert Reaches Plea Deal in Bank Withdrawals Case
